meanings.definition: The quality of being extremely thin and bony.
meanings.sent1: Her gauntness was evident in the sharp angles of her face.
meanings.sent2: The gauntness of the stray dog made it clear it hadn't eaten in days.
meanings.sent3: Despite his gauntness, he still managed to out-eat everyone at the buffet.
meanings.sent4: The gauntness of the tree branches in winter resembled skeletal fingers reaching for the sky.
meanings.sent5: The gauntness of the old house gave it a haunted, eerie look.

meanings.definition: A skeletal appearance due to extreme leanness or emaciation.
meanings.sent1: The gauntness of the scarecrow made it look almost lifelike.
meanings.sent2: His gauntness was a result of months of limited food supply.
meanings.sent3: The gauntness of the Halloween decorations made the house look spooky.
meanings.sent4: The gauntness of the landscape in the drought-stricken region was a stark reminder of the harsh conditions.
meanings.sent5: The gauntness of the actor's face added authenticity to his role as a starving prisoner.
